The waitress looks at the man irritatedly, then picks up money and moves away. Duncan slowly sits down again. He pulls the cup back to  himself, then turns and looks at the man for a long momen unable to express his gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of shots of BUMS, "homeless persons", hanging ou in alleys, in the doorways of old buildings, sitting on t sidewalk in front of liquor stores. Then we see Duncan, alone but looking no different from t others. He is panhandling PASSERSBY, without much success We see him fall into a fit of coughing that incapacitates him for several seconds. He's obviously getting sicker. We lose sight of Duncan as our MONTAGE continues. We see  Clifford talking to a BUM, then another. He is passing th time combing the streets in the neighborhood of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: PARK
dialogues.text: A handful of BUMS are sitting together on the grass passi a bottle in a brown paper bag. Duncan is not among them, Cheater is there, sitting at the end of the line. CAMERA PANS from one bum to the next as the bottle is pas By the time it gets to Cheater, it is empty. Cheater look as if he's about to cry like a baby when a hand enters th frame from the other side -- the hand holding out to Chea a full bottle of wine. Cheater takes the bottle and looks gratefully... to see John Clifford standing beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! I can't say much for your  protocol, but your timing's dead on.  Here's to you, pardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheater takes a long drink, then passes the bottle back d the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all the bums) I'm looking for an old buddy of mine,  English fella. Name's Crazy Curt.  Any of you guys seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe him some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaahh. Show me an honest man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing) Stands about so. Brown hair. Face  kind of banged up. Was in an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? I was just with that guy,  not more'n an hour ago. Looked bad.  Crazy Curt, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheater scratches his head, and glances anxiously down th line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I can't remember. Prob'bly see  him again though. Tell you what. You  leave the money with me, I'll see he  gets it... as a favor to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsa matter? You don't trust me?  I'll have you know I used to be a  college professor. We can work  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford stands to go. The bottle comes back to Cheater,  three-quarters down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Keep the bottle. I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Long life to the grape! For when  summer is flown, The age of our nectar  Shall gladden our own." That's  Shelley, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford is gone. Cheater takes a long drink and almost  forgets that Clifford was ever there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford is "suiting up" for his night's work. He is dres casually -- blue jeans, shirt open at the neck, sports ja Adidas running shoes. He looks at himself in the mirror, satisfied. Then he picks up from the dresser two awl-like instruments with short handles and long, glistening taper needlepoints -- his weapons. He slides them into a leathe sheath inside his jacket and turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is lit up inside. The bar is open for business. Across the street in a dark space between two buildings, Duncan waiting, watching the front door of the bar to see who co out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is empty but for Hank who half watches the  television over the bar, and Tracy who sits alone in a co Several moments pass as both of them sit and wait. Then, the front door starts to swing open. Someone is com in. Tracy and Hank both glance nervously toward the door. A MAN'S head peeks in. He is somewhere in his forties, a  regular customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hank, what're you doing open  tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relaxing) Trying to make a buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The customer walks up to the bar, sits down and talks qui with Hank. Tracy looks nervously at her wristwatch. She stubs out he cigarette, takes one last gulp of her drink and stands up go. She walks to the bar, opens her purse and reaches inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it, honey. My treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a meaningful look. Then she heads for the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) That how you make a buck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy looks up and down the street, hoping to see Cliffor somewhere, afraid of glimpsing Duncan instead. Then she s walking quickly homeward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following Tracy to her apartment. We pick up Clifford now and we cut back and forth between the two of them -- her  walking quickly, never looking back, and him sneaking alo several hundred feet behind her, looking everywhere for  Duncan, whom we never see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks up the steps and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy steps off the elevator and goes to her door. She fu through her purse for the key. Then she hears footsteps o the stairs. She turns. It's Clifford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming forward: half- whispering) No luck. You see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still could be out there, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Oh, God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is starting to come apart, and she suddenly leans on  Clifford for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy stands there for several seconds to regain control herself. Then she steps away and turns back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to hang around outside for  awhile. I'll be back on and off again  all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy gets the door unlocked. She pushes it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy steps in. Clifford stays in the doorway. They are s whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Bolt your door. Don't let  anybody in, no matter what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be seeing you. (starts to move off;  comes back) Listen. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy closes the door and throws the bolt. Then she walks into the apartment and out of frame. CAMERA STAYS in the  hallway. We can hear Tracy moving about O.S. Then, as if on its own, the door to the hall closet slowl swings open... ...until we can see Duncan standing inside the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy is putting some coffee on. Then she removes her coa and walks out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy goes up to the closet with her coat. The door is cl She opens it. She hangs up her coat and closes the door a Then she turns and starts walking out of the hallway to t living room. As she is rounding the corner into the living room, she w right into Duncan. She barely has time to gasp before he  clamps his hand over her mouth and pushes her against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent whisper) I just have to talk to you. (pathetically) I want you to be my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she isn't struggling, he starts to loosen up on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his hand away from her mouth, lets go of her, an slowly, cautiously steps back. Tracy looks at him for a  breathless moment, her eyes wild with fear. Then she scre Duncan jumps back, stunned, frightened and confused. Trac doesn't move. She just keeps screaming hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy's screams carry out into the night as Clifford race across the street and into the apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan runs to a window, throws it open and climbs out on the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT STAIRS AND FIRE ESCAPE
dialogues.text: As Clifford bounds up the stairs, flight after flight, an Duncan tears down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screaming has stopped when Clifford reaches Tracy's d He grabs the doorknob and heaves himself against the door It's bolted shut. Clifford pulls one of the needles from his jacket and ham it into the lock. The bolt springs and Clifford runs into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Clifford bursts in. Tracy gestures toward the window.  Clifford runs to it and sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFORD
dialogues.text: Duncan is gone.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Clifford runs to a window on another wall and looks out o the street.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFORD
dialogues.text: No sign of the Englishman.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Clifford runs out of the apartment, yanking his needle fr the lock as he passes the door, and charges back down the stairs. Tracy moves to the door and closes it. She is breathing  heavily. O.S. we hear the angry sizzle of coffee spilling onto the hot stove, as Tracy goes to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford comes out, looks around and moves rapidly up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan is hurrying along, dodging in and out of people, t to move quickly but not draw attention to himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford is travelling along the sidewalk, crossing the  street, looking everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan is running up the alley. He comes to a stop beside some piled up trash cans. He leans against the brick wall the building, huffing and puffing. He is frightened, but feels safe for now. He slowly slides down the wall to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan is curled up in the corner of a bare cell with pad walls. He is in a strait-jacket. His head is shaved. We c tell what he is thinking, except that he's obviously deep frightened and cannot understand what's happening to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the children's bedroom in Dr. Mandrakis' house of six years ago. It is dark. Two small beds occupy one corn of the room. We can see two small lumps on the beds, but more. Duncan sits in the foreground with a telephone on his lap He is dialing a number. The phone rings three times befor it is answered -- or rather, picked up, because there is voice on the other end. After several seconds the phone i hung up. Duncan hangs up and thinks for a moment. He picks up the  phone and dials again. This time he gets a busy signal. H hangs up, stands and goes to the door. He opens it slowly peers out. Jill's voice can be heard faintly talking to t operator, asking for the police. Duncan closes the door and comes back into the room, mumb He goes to the window, looks out. Then he goes to the  children's beds.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: As he raises the covers and stares down into the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freighter, broad and low, arduously cuts through the wa Early morning mist hangs over the deck which is empty but for a lone FIGURE standing on the prow.

dialogues.speaker: LONE FIGURE
dialogues.text: It is Curt Duncan. He is looking out over the front of th ship. Another SEAMAN comes up behind him and claps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this will be your first time? (laughs) An old salt like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan moves away, wanting to be left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still laughing;  slightly punchy) You'll love it here. It's where they  make the bombs. It's where they make  the planes that carry the bombs; the  planes we saw over Singapore and  Manila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is. That's America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coast of Southern California emerges through the mist foghorn blows somewhere in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he peers ahead with inscrutable interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. A little BOY is lying in bed, apparently asleep. Th is Curt Duncan as a child. Some voices approach in the hallway outside the bedroom.  They are gruff, with heavy English accents, but subdued; MAN and a WOMAN, well into middle-age. The boy's eyes open as he listens:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it for later. Let's go out and  get some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the lad? You can't leave  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curt's asleep. He'll never know we're  gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside, a key enters the lock of the bedroom door a turns. The bolt slips and the door is securely shut. The boy sits up in bed, apprehensive. In TIGHT SHOTS of t floor we see a rat come out from under the bed, then anot They make "chit-chit" noises as they begin to explore. On of them maybe goes up on its hind legs and nibbles on the bedpost. Then we see two more rats appear. We go for a TIGHT SHOT of the boy on top of the bed. The  "chit-chit" noises grow steadily louder as the boy's  apprehension turns to fear, then to terror. The boy start to whimper. Suddenly, we cut back to a WIDE SHOT of the room. The flo is crawling with rats, hundreds of them. The "chit-chit"  rises to practically a roar as the boy, alone on top of t bed, begins to wail. The room seems to darken, and the boy becomes just a litt white speck in it. The focus is turned. The picture becom a black and white blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first all that can be seen is a white blur against a b screen. The previous sound of a boy crying increases. The the blur grows larger, coming more into focus as the enti screen image moves toward normal definition. Finally, we  know we are back in the alleyway, that it is night, and t the white blur is actually a little BOY lost, sobbing  uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Awakening to the scene, coming back to reality. He is  confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy continues sobbing, moving about in little circles Duncan, amazed at what he sees, slowly crawls out from th wall on his hands and knees, crawls toward the weeping ch staring at it with a strange look on his face. Suddenly the boy stops crying and looks at Duncan quizzic hesitantly. They are less than a foot apart, almost face face. Together they form a kind of frozen tableau. Someth close to sympathy crosses the killer's expression, and th boy, likewise, achieves a faint sense of recognition. Then, just as suddenly, the boy starts wailing again and runs off down the alleyway. Duncan watches him disappear. Then he slowly pulls himself to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford is coming up the sidewalk. As Clifford crosses t entrance to an alleyway, the boy comes running out and al collides with him. Clifford grabs the boy and looks down him. Then he passes the wailing child off on a nearby  PEDESTRIAN and runs up into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan is hurrying along the sidewalk. Something makes hi look up.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: He is looking at a neon "Jesus Saves" sign above the door to an inner city mission.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON DUNCAN
dialogues.text: As he stares at the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Crazy Curt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan turns to see Cheater elatedly hobbling up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail fellow well met, and all that  jazz. It's our lucky day! (taking Duncan by the  arm) A friend of your's got money for  you. We got to get back to the park  and meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan pulls his arm free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. He'll be comin' for you, Crazy  Curt. S'got some money. (reaching for Duncan's  arm) We'll get us a little joy juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan pulls free again and heads toward the mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! Hey!! You really are crazy!  C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan enters the mission and Cheater stands out on the  sidewalk for a moment, bitterly frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks!  Rage! Blow, you cataracts and  hurricanoes, spout till you have  drench'd our steeples and drown'd  the cocks!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several PEDESTRIANS stop and gape at this sudden outburst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford comes out of a derelict hotel, looks up and down the street and hurries off, not giving up the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN is leading Duncan to the bathroom. Duncan enters sl and goes to one of the wash basins where there is an old  razor blade and a can of shaving cream. Duncan picks up t razor for a moment and looks at it. He is lost in thought Then he sets it down and turns on the tap water. He glances at himself in the mirror and is suddenly trans by his own image. He looks deeply into the mirror for sev seconds. Then he starts to cry, and having begun, a flood emotions comes pouring out of him. He drops to his knees. The man comes running back into the bathroom. He holds Du and helps pull him back to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheater is trudging along the sidewalk, hands in pockets, head lowered. He looks up and sees something that brings back to life.

dialogues.speaker: CHEATER
dialogues.text: Clifford is standing on the corner up ahead, looking arou

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Cheater calls out and starts to run toward Clifford. Clifford turns, sees Cheater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "sleeping dorm". It is a large empty room. Thirty or OUTCASTS are stretched out on the bare floor in the darkn Their combined snoring/wheezing creates a steady, ghastly din. The door at the far end of the hall opens. A figure steps and quietly closes the door behind him. He stands for a m taking in the scene, letting his eyes adjust to the darkn Then he slowly creeps forward to the prone body of the ne sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE
dialogues.text: It is Clifford. He moves stealthily from one body to the  next. In one hand he carries a small flashlight. He turns the bodies over just long enough to shine the light in th faces and identify who they are, or rather who they are n Then he moves on. In his other hand he holds a small, gle Jimmy needle.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: He's sleeping, but his eyes suddenly open, sensing danger He turns over and sees the dark figure of Clifford slowly advancing toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford keeps coming, closer and closer to where Duncan  lies. He is but six or seven bodies away when Duncan jump up suddenly and bolts for the door. Clifford looks up, sees the fleeing figure and charges af it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing through a maze of narrow hallways, Duncan can't st to think where he's going. Clifford is barreling after hi some forty yards behind. Duncan rounds a corner and ten yards up ahead, the hallwa deadends in a set of double doors. Duncan has no choice b to hurl himself against the doors. They yield and he goes through them. Four seconds later, Clifford comes to the same doors and  pushes through to the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Clifford comes through the doors which are a side entr into the chancel of this large, gothic-style church. Behi him now, is the altar. Before him stretches the nave of t edifice with its rows of pews, its dimly glowing stained  glass windows, and way in the back, its choir loft. At re intervals, tiny shafts of light pierce the darkness from high. There is no sign of Duncan, but Clifford knows he must be here, hiding somewhere. He slowly walks forward to the fr of the chancel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan. Duncan. It's over now. Come  on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Duncan doesn't come out. Clifford holds very still He hears nothing. He speaks again and his voice echoes th the large empty church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's John Clifford. I'm a private  detective. I've been hired by  Alexander Mandrakis to take you back.  I'm not going to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: Hiding beneath a pew. He hears the name "Mandrakis" and i registers like a thunderbolt. He silently mouths the name "Mandrakis". Then he hears Clifford's footsteps approaching.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFORD
dialogues.text: Slowly moving up the center aisle, looking from side to s into the pews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently; coaxing) I'm not going to hurt you... I'm not  going to hurt you... There'll be no  more pain... You're safe now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford moves closer and closer to Duncan's row until  finally, Duncan can bear it no longer. He jumps up from  beneath the pew and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) No! Mandrakis! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford chases him through the pews and up the aisles to the front of the church. He is clutching a needle in both hands, ready to strike. Duncan flees through a narrow door off to the side of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan faces a spiraling stone staircase. He has no choic but to climb them, higher and higher, the sound of Cliffo angry footsteps always coming up behind him. Finally, Duncan can climb no higher. He is at the top of bell tower. A lanceted opening in the stone wall ahead of him looks out over the narrow shaft of the tower. Above h are the huge iron bells. A rope hangs down from the bells dangling all the way down the shaft, forty or fifty feet the floor of the church. Clifford is bounding up the last flight of steps to get h Duncan has little choice. He is trapped. Just before Clif reaches him, Duncan leaps out into the shaft and catches bell rope. The bell starts to clang as Duncan, hanging in mid air, s back and forth within the narrow shaft. Clifford leans wa out through the lancet window and takes a swipe at Duncan but the madman is just beyond his reach and hurriedly cli down the rope. Clifford reaches out and tries to grab at the rope. At la he gets it, and he shakes it violently to get Duncan to l his grip and be dashed against the stone floor below. But Duncan holds firm, climbing ever downward. The bell  continues to clang, sending its alarm out into the night. Then Clifford braces himself and slowly, laboriously begi to haul up on the rope. Clifford gains momentum until Duncan is being pulled up f than he is climbing down. Still twenty feet off the groun Duncan lets go of the rope and plummets to the hard stone floor. Then PEOPLE come rushing into the church, awakened by the commotion of the bells. Duncan rolls into the shadows and drags himself out a side door, while Clifford plans his o escape from the bell tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford runs up the alleyway, looks around and finally  realizes he's lost his prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan is hidden deep in the shadows of a nook between tw buildings, catching his breath. CAMERA MOVES IN on him, a we see him looking the craziest he's ever been. He shakes uncontrollably and begins to mumble, softly at first, the getting louder. He's falling back into the grips of Guy d Marraux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A. All is still and quiet as soft, warm sunlight pours in the dirty streets and alleyways. In the background, the b tower of the church rises above the skyline. B. We see a SHOT of the park -- all the bums are asleep. C. Then a SHOT of the mission -- its front door open, the sidewalk empty. D. Then the bar, where the same peaceful mood prevails. E. Then the alleyway where we last saw Curt Duncan. Now h is gone. F. Then the exterior of Tracy's apartment building. Cliff car is parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to see my two kids every  weekend. They lived in a nice house  with their father, outside the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy and Clifford are sitting at a small table in the  kitchen, looking haggard, drinking coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... it's been years. They're grown  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. Clifford is a sympathetic listen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look at where I am now. I know I  could've done better, but... it's  too late for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you've got to keep looking, I  suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking his cue, Clifford slowly rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he'll come back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy looks up at him questioningly, wishing she could fe as sure about it as he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hand) Thanks... for all your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy takes his hand. They shake warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it wasn't easy. (turning to go) Maybe, someday, I'll be able to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you wouldn't leave me  altogether...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a laugh) I'm not a young woman anymore. I've  given up all my dreams of the future.  Now, I just want to make it to the  end. You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford smiles at her gently. He knows exactly what she  means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford takes a few steps, turns back, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like ice cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What flavor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chocolate chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford nods his head slightly, as if registering this i his memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at each other for a second then Clifford leave and Tracy sits alone in her kitchen, listening to him go, hearing the door close behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on a section of a newspaper lying in the gutter. pair of feet enters the frame and stands beside the newsp We hear a familiar cough. Then a trembling hand reaches d and picks up the newspaper. Pause. Something in the newspaper has caught his eye. The the feet shuffle out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest middle-income neighborhood where young married  couples buy their first home and start their family. CAMERA is facing down the quiet street. In the foreground on the street, two small CHILDREN, a little boy and a lit girl, are playing. They are adorable kids. CAMERA PANS ninety degrees with the children as they run of the street and up the sidewalk to their house. A TITLE APPEARS across the bottom of the screen: 5 pm Friday, April 28, 1978

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE FADES as the children push open the front door and  enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They noisily and excitedly make their way to the kitchen. The children are four and two and a half years old, STEVI and JUNE respectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the kids enter, their MOTHER is working at the stove, back to CAMERA. JUNE & STEVIE (together) Hi, Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother turns around. It is Jill Johnson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Well, look what the wind blew in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES IN on her as she comes forward, bends down,  kisses Stevie, and picks up June. Jill looks older, more  mature, but still very pretty. She is Mrs. John Lockhart  now, and has left her memories of the past behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, what's for dinner? Could we  have hamburgers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Is that all you ever want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall phone in the kitchen starts to ring. Stevie goes t answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Hey, how's my little tiger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is JOHN LOCKHART on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, Junie threw my baseball down  the street; and I can't find it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll look for it real hard  later. Let me talk to mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill, by this time, has come to the phone. She is still  holding June.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Bye, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie hands the phone to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, babe -- whaddya say you put on a  sexy dress, and I take you out to  dinner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is very happy about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great... what's the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Just a little surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving here now; be home in  half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, see ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jill hangs up the phone, Stevie pipes up O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, is Daddy gonna get me a new  baseball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford's car is parked in the driveway, and we see him  getting out. He goes to the front door -- the porch light on and perhaps one other lamp somewhere inside the otherw dark house. He rings the bell, waits, rings again... Finally the door is opened by the Houseboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. and Mrs. Mandrakis are out of  town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three more weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just as well. Will you be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford takes a business card from his pocket and gives to the Houseboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Call if you need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Houseboy reads the card as Clifford walks back to his car. Then the Houseboy closes the front door. Clifford pauses beside his car for a moment, looking back the rich, dark home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children are in bed. Jill is sitting next to Stevie.  Only a nightlight is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I pray the Lord my soul to keep.  If I die before I wake, I pray the  Lord my soul to take. God bless Mommy  and Daddy and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Granmom and Aunt Lucy and  Uncle George...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pausing) ...and her. Now will you tell us a  story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I will not tell you a story. You  go to sleep now. And be good. Carol  will be here while we're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, will you come here a minute?  I want to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill stands up and goes over to June's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill bends closer to her daughter. O.S. the doorbell ring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too, Junebug. (kissing her) Goodnight. Sleep tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill stands up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jill comes down the stairs. CAROL, the sitter, is at t foot of the stairs with John. Carol has an armful of  schoolbooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Lockhart. I saw your  picture in the paper the other day.  Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugggh... wasn't it a dreadful picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill crosses to a hall table, picks up a phone book, flip through it, then writes on a notepad beside the phone. Ov this action...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the kids asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will be soon. (to Carol) Give them about twenty minutes and  then take a peek -- but if Stevie  sees you, you'll have to tell him a  story. (beat) Here's the number of the restaurant.  Call us if you need us. For police,  ambulance, any emergency like that,  just dial 911. You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine-one-one? Oh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just in case, I've written the  number of the children's Uncle George  and Aunt Lucy here, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, in ten seconds I eat the  staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts down the pad and crosses to a closet where she t out a lightweight coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing the coat to  John) Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not taking the coat) I'm not wearing that thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill shoves the coat into his stomach. Smiling, he takes coat and dutifully helps her on with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling her out the  door) Bye, Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Jill walk to the station wagon in the driveway a Carol shuts the front door in the background. Just before Jill gets into the car, she takes a look back at the hous there is a moment's hesitance, and then she gets in the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol picks up the phone and carries it into the living r with her. As she does it, we see lying on the phone table the newspaper clipping with Jill's picture, and headline: "Jill Lockhart Chairs Community UNICEF Drive." She puts the phone down, then her books, then herself. Sh dials a number. Her BOYFRIEND answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you come over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I really have a lot of work  to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Ohhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Italian Restaurant. Quiet music, soft lights, red and  white checkered tablecloths, candles, a smokey and seduct atmosphere. DOLLY with a LATIN WAITER carrying a huge tray of food ov head. He passes right by the table where Jill and John ar sitting. John watches him take the food to someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for a  breadstick) I've eaten enough breadsticks to  turn into a pretzel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, tell me about the surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Brace yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm braced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I got the sack today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The can... I was fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Wally did call me into his  office today. And he did tell me I  didn't have my old job anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting excited) John, what did you get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guessing) District Sales Manager!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regional!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regional?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, District.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beside herself) John, I don't believe it! District  Sales Manager!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER arrives with their food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's about time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter looks up, offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to waiter) Not you. (back to John) It's about time they recognized you  for what you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your dinner, folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ignore him. He moves away. John digs right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) I'll be the youngest District Manager  in the company's history. God, am I  hungry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not eating yet) Does this mean a raise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John flags down a passing WAITER and signals that their w glasses need filling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John leans forward and whispers in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding! And a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I'm so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pauses, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You don't like  your food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAITRE D' has come up to the table. John stops sudden They are both very chagrined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Lockhart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a telephone call for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John starts to get up. Jill grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat your dinner. It's probably Carol.  I'll talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill stands up and follows the Maitre D' through the othe tables to the telephone. She picks up the receiver. CAMER MOVES in on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you checked the children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill screams and falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Around him, other DINERS fall instantly silent and wonder what is going on. WAITERS stop dead in their tracks. John leaps up from his seat and dashes through the tables like a madman. Suddenly the restaurant comes alive with  excitement and alarm.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: As John runs up and drops to his knees beside her. She is shaking and sobbing uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill, what's happening? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him! Somebody call the police!  Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other PEOPLE have crowded around and are making urgent no now about calling the police, an ambulance, etc. John tri to cut through the confusion and anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Just hold on!  Sweetheart, what was him? What are  you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man... Curt Duncan... He's home  again! He's got our children!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill nods. John grabs the telephone and quickly dials a number. The  crowd tries to quiet down, as much to hear for themselves to let John talk. The phone rings and rings. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Carol, it's Mr. Lockhart.  What's going on over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, there's nothing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. Why? What's --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, listen to me very carefully.  If there's a man in the house, if  there's any reason why you can't  talk to me right now, just answer  yes to me over the phone. That's  all. If there's any danger of any  kind, just say yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause. They wait for her answer. Jill is listening i the receiver now, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what's happening.  What man in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is confused. John breathes a guarded sigh of relief. Jill takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, it's Mrs. Lockhart. Answer me  truthfully. When was the last time  you looked in on the children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About forty-five minutes ago.  Everything's fine. They were fast  asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill gives her husband a look. John takes the phone again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, I'm sorry about all the  hysterics. We're leaving the  restaurant now. We'll explain  everything when we get home. Before  we hang up, could you do just one  more thing for me, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you go upstairs and, and check  on the children for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is violently shaking her head. John silences her wit gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol O.S. puts the phone down. Then there is silence on other end. The crowd of people around Jill and John begin shuffle and murmur. John tries to keep them quiet while  listening into the phone. Then TWO POLICEMEN come forward through the crowd. One of them kneels down to John and Jill who are still on the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What seems to be the problem here,  sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Officer, I'm John Lockhart. Just a  second please, and I'll explain  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to  Policeman) I'm Jill Johnson, the babysitter  seven years ago with the child killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This means nothing to Policeman #1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The babysitter. The guy got into the  house and killed the two children  upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Policeman #2 kneels down now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Oh, yeah, I remember something about  that. A Greek doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. That's the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Policeman #1) It was in the seventh precinct...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the two policemen and John mumble between themselves,  Jill takes the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listening) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses the receiver tighter to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John quiets down the policeman. Jill can now hear what sh couldn't a second ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing hysterical) Carol? Carol?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOOM into the telephone until we can also hear what Jill reacting to. It grows louder and louder... A dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Jill pull up in the station wagon followed by a  squad car -- no sirens or lights. They all get out and ru for the front door. John pulls out his key to open the door... and discovers  that it's unlocked. Cautiously, they step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look into the living room. Carol isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol? Carol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. The policemen tentatively draw their guns. Jil bolts up the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Policeman #2 runs up after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jill runs down to the children's bedroom followed by  Policeman #2. She opens the door and rushes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children are in bed, asleep. Policeman #2 stands in t doorway as Jill goes up to June and bends over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening her eyes) Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill kisses her gently on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sshhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June closes her eyes and immediately falls back to sleep. Jill walks over to Stevie's bed and looks down at him. He turns slightly in his sleep. Satisfied that her children are safe, Jill pulls up the c on Stevie and then walks slowly out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill quietly pulls the door shut, and Policeman #2 walks  back up the hallway. Jill leans against the wall and buri her face in her hands. She is drained. She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing was wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I got back to the phone, the  line was dead. I figured we got cut  off somehow. What's been going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is sitting on a corner of the bed, looking at the fl John sits on the other corner, facing away from her, slow unbuttoning his shirt. After a long silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I ever get my hands on the guy  that made that call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, it wasn't a prank. I know that  voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disguised it though, didn't he?  Same as before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we just sit here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns and moves over beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we promised never to talk about  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REACTION SHOT of Jill. She is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we supposed to do? Leave  town? Take the kids and lock ourselves  up somewhere? Come on... Let's get a  good night's sleep, and in the morning  we can rethink this whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing has to be rethought. And I'm  not about to fall asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to relax, honey. I'm here. We're  both here. The house is locked up.  The cops'll be just outside all night  long. We're safe now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they told me before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands up and goes to his dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Look. If it'll make you feel  any better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a revolver from the dresser drawer and emphatica checks the action. Then he walks to his side of the bed a sets the pistol on his bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep it right here beside me  all night. You know I'm a light  sleeper and a damn good shot. Are  you satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Jill tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I'm sorry to be putting you  through all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're not putting me through  anything that you don't have to go  through yourself. I'm with you all  the way. Trust me. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill nods. John leans forward and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and walks out of the room talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now try to relax. We'll get some  sleep. You'll be surprised how  differently things will look in the  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (complaining) Honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so loud. You're going to wake  the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John comes back into the bedroom with a glass of water an couple of pills in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Naw. Those kids'd sleep through an  earthquake. They're good kids. (handing her the pills  and water) Here, take a couple of these. They're  just what the doctor ordered.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: As she takes the pills and swallows them, one at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I read somewhere about  this psychological thing called  hysterical delusion or hysterical  recall or something. It had to do  with how an event from your past can  sneak up on you sometimes and fool  you when it's only just a memory. I  don't know. We'll talk about it in  the morning. Maybe there's someone  we can see about that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lounge area in the back of the station. At one table, three OFFICERS are playing bridge. Garber with his back t CAMERA rounds out their game. At a nearby table closer to CAMERA, Policeman #1 is worki on a crossword puzzle. POLICEMAN #3, sitting next to him, reading a paperback novel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a word for "an outsider, of  sorts"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trespasser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. Eight letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. Starts with an "I".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Policeman #3 thinks briefly, then goes back to his novel. Policeman #2 enters the room carrying a printout of some  sort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bert. A report just came in on  that guy, Curt Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: GARBER
dialogues.text: At the bridge table, perking up his ears, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broke outta the nuthouse two months  ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garber is keeping only half an eye on the card game. He p a card from his hand and throws it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? You going to put that in  our report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diamonds, Charlie. Diamonds was led.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garber hastily picks up his card and throws down another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course I'm going to put it in the  report. Maybe this gal tonight really  did get a call from him. Who knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lead, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garber throws down another card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? That's  a trump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A card laid is a card played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right. We'd better leave  that on Ruznik's desk in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toss 'em in. I got the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Kay-Reist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garber throws down his cards. He stands up and approaches Policeman #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Tucker, lemme see that a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Policeman #2 hands the sheet of paper to Garber. Garber  quickly scans the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys have a stake on the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernstein and Waller are checkin' it  every twenty minutes or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing back the  sheet) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garber exits to his office. Policeman #2 walks over to wh Policeman #1 is still sitting, working the crossword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's an eight letter word for  "an outsider, of sorts"? Starts with  an "I".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intruder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! Intruder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garber sits thinking for a moment. He is trying to come t decision. He reaches for the phone and dials. It rings an then is picked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff?... I think I got something  for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of the downstairs hall. All is dark and still, ver still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is tossing in her sleep. John is fast asleep next to her, on his side facing away from her. Then, Jill wakes u She is heavily sedated, groggy. She hardly knows where sh is at first. She pulls herself up to a sitting position on the side of the bed. She tries to gather her wits. Then she gets up a walks slowly out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING JILL
dialogues.text: Through the upstairs hallway, down the staircase and towa the kitchen. The darkness around her is ominous, threaten She stops at the dining room window and looks out. On the street a patrol car slowly passes and disappears down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill enters, turns on the light, opens a cupboard and tak out a glass. She goes to the refrigerator and opens it.  Suddenly, the lights go out. Jill closes the refrigerator door and goes and turns on  another light. Apparently, only a lightbulb has blown. Ji unscrews the burned-out bulb from its socket and throws i in the trash. She leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill walks to a hall closet and opens it. A light comes o inside as she does so. A puzzled, half-startled expressio comes onto her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the closet, half the hangers with coats, etc., are the floor. Sound over: A telephone being dialed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford has just finished dialing the phone. He waits,  nothing happens. Then a strange, siren-like noise comes o of the telephone. Clifford listens, then hangs up. He picks up the .38 he has lying on the desk and idly sta flipping the cartridge chamber with one of his jimmy need After a moment, he lays the gun down and picks up the pho again, this time calling the OPERATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you dial a local number for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the number, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The operator dials. There is a pause. Then the same stran noise cuts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator, what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, that line seems to  be disconnected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I get a recording?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, sir. Maybe the number  was just recently disconnected. Maybe  there's a temporary malfunction in  the wiring. Why don't you try it  again in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is walking down the hall to the children's bedroom. opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
